newsitem.title: USA: U.S. PRODUCER PRICES DOWN FOR RECORD SEVENTH STRAIGHT.
newsitem.headline: U.S. PRODUCER PRICES DOWN FOR RECORD SEVENTH STRAIGHT.

text.p: Wholesale prices dropped unexpectedly for a record seventh month in a row, the government said on Wednesday in a report offering more proof the economy can grow strongly without producing inflation.

The Labor Department said the 0.1 percent decline in its July Producer Price Index followed an identical drop in June. Without the volatile food and energy components, wholesale prices also fell by 0.1 percent last month.
